page.title: 15RECREATION 1
page.content: During the latter part of the last century a large amount of gravel was excavated to the west of Rickmansworth some of which went to help build the London Underground System.The holes left filled up with water from underground springs making two lakes, Batchworth and Bury Lakes.These and the surroundings area of about 100 acres are known as the Aquadrome.It forms part of the Colne Valley Regional Park and is located alongside the Grand Union Canal. There is a recreation ground with swings, roundabouts and slides for children. There is a free car park and numerous paths for walkers around the lakes. There are facilities for swimming, windsurfing, water ski-ing and an active sailing club.It is popular in season with anglers and some parts are kept as nature reserves.
